Array: An eleventh-grader at Paulownia Academy High School.
Protege to Kou Kibiki, and has even taken up resi-
dence in his house (rent-free) for private reasons.
Discovered the 'Sachiko Ever After' charm and shared
it on her blog, prompting the events that got Ayumi
and her friends mixed up with Heavenly Host.
A struggling documentarian and novelist looking
for his big break. Writes primarily for an occult
publication of questionable relevance.
Has been chasing any leads he can find on the serial
kidnapping and murder cases that once plagued
Heavenly Host Elementary.
Eventually spirited himself away to Heavenly Host
by choice, where he was killed by Naho after she'd
succumbed to the darkening.
An eleventh-grader at Byakudan Senior High School.
Went to Heavenly Host Elementary with Yuuya Kizami
and his other classmates.
When his friend Ryosuke Katayama's body was kicked
down the stairs by Kizami, he called Kizami a mur-
derer, setting in motion a series of dark events.
を作る事になる。
A lone frog soaking in formalin sits upon the top
shelf, eagerly awaiting dissection.
A seventh-grader at Musashigawa Girls' Middle School
and a prominent member of its drama club. Performed
Sachiko Ever After with her fellow club members.
った。
Best friends with Nana Ogasawara. Possesses a timid,
almost cowardly personality, depending entirely on
her friends to help her through this experience.
A seventh-grader at Musashigawa Girls' Middle School
and a prominent member of its drama club. Performed
Sachiko Ever After with her fellow club members.
った。
A childhood friend of Nana Ogasawara's who doesn't
make any effort to hide her true feelings, unkind or
no -- though she cares very deeply for her friends.
An eleventh-grader at Byakudan Senior High School.
Student council clerk. Went to Heavenly Host Ele-
mentary with Yuuya Kizami and her other classmates.
Due to the shock of Yoshikazu's attack and being
separated from her group, she had difficulty hang-
ing on to her sanity by the time she met Satoshi.
くなっていた。
A lone frog soaking in formalin sits upon the top
shelf, eagerly awaiting dissection.
An eleventh-grader at Byakudan Senior High School.
Was transported to Heavenly Host Elementary with
Tomohiro Ohkawa, Kensuke Kurosaki and the others.
Joined his classmates in searching for a way out
at first, but was steadily consumed by the school's
madness as time went on.
A seventh-grader at Musashigawa Girls' Middle School
and a prominent member of its drama club. Performed
Sachiko Ever After with her fellow club members.
しまった。
Joined forces with Chihaya Yamase and Nari Amatoya
in a vain search through the halls of Heavenly Host
for her other missing classmates.
An eleventh-grader at Byakudan Senior High School.
Went to Heavenly Host Elementary with Yuuya Kizami
and his other classmates.
A childhood friend of Yuuya Kizami's, though Kizami
has already lost his mind by the time the two of
them reunite.
A lone frog soaking in formalin sits upon the top
shelf, eagerly awaiting dissection.
A skilled cameraman who works as Kou Kibiki's
assistant. Came to Heavenly Host with his boss,
but the two of them quickly got separated.
After learning of Kibiki and Naho's deaths, he swore
to them both that he'd perform his duties as camera-
man to the bitter end, no matter what.
[Character Introductions]
Use the eye to interact with any character and
learn more about them.
When you're done, exit through the door on the
southeast side of the room to resume play.
A 17-year-old student in Kisaragi Academy Senior
High class 2-9. Fairly average, but popular. Known
for being both kind and cowardly in equal measure.
持つ。
Despite his timidness, he's very personable and
open, which complements his general sensitivity
toward others to make him a natural leader.
The one person ever to challenge that leadership
is Naomi -- who is, consequently, the only person to
whom Satoshi regularly defers judgment.
A 17-year-old student in Kisaragi High class 2-9.
Often regarded as sarcastic and cynical, but as far
as he's concerned, he's just being honest.
は自分に素直な正直者である。
Although generally not one to participate in events,
his fondness for Satoshi and Ayumi means he'll make
an exception now and again if either is involved.
ている。
With intense drama at home, Yoshiki currently works
part-time after school to afford rent on a small
apartment, where he lives alone.
The 17-year-old appointed representative of Kisaragi
High class 2-9. Often subjects her classmates to
ghost stories, and revels in hearing them scream.
It's generally believed that she carries candles and
other 'horror goods' with her at all times, just in
case an opportunity presents itself to use them.
In truth, however, Ayumi wears this reputation as
a mask to hide her own fear of the unknown, which
rivals even Satoshi's in its intensity.
When faced with any truly scary situation, her knees
give out and panic sets in. Only her personal pride
can break her out of this fear-induced state.
A lone frog soaking in formalin sits upon the top
shelf, eagerly awaiting dissection.
A 16-year-old student in Kisaragi High class 2-9.
He's been in theater club with Mayu since middle
school, and developed a real closeness with her.
うな関係になっている。
He finds socializing with anyone else to be more
trouble than it's worth, however, so he typically
regards his other classmates with indifference.
り、どんな場にいても孤立している事が多い。
Takes great pride in his family heritage, and reacts
violently if anyone makes fun of his name. The only
exception is the nickname Mayu's given him: 'Shig.'
ると本気でキレる。
A 16-year-old student in Kisaragi High class 2-9.
Somehow looks much tinier than she actually is, but
possesses a big heart and a bright personality.
～３年生まで如月学園全校にファンがいる。
Accepts anyone and everyone with open arms, never
playing favorites, which has earned her nearly
universal regard amongst her fellow students.
Unfortunately, due to familial circumstances, this
was Mayu's last day at Kisaragi High. She'll be
moving shortly, and transferring to a new school.
It's a fairly plain, unremarkable desk. There's
nothing about it that's particularly noteworthy.
A 16-year-old student in Kisaragi High class 2-9,
and a classmate of Satoshi's since junior high.
Frequently greets Satoshi with, 'Oh, not YOU again!'
りです」が挨拶のようになっている。
Having lost her father a few years back, Naomi and
her mother now depend on one another for moral
support. Still, she remains optimistic and cheerful.
Her home life has given her an interest in nursing,
which she's intent on pursuing. She spends her time
studying, aiming for acceptance to medical school.
Satoshi's 14-year-old sister. Though she's an
eighth-grader at Kisaragi Academy Junior High
School, she looks and acts much, much younger.
ってしまった。
In the Mochida household, Yuka's always been the
'princess,' generally getting her way and thus
never really shedding her childlike behavior.
Despite this, she yearns to grow up, often
attempting to act older or braver than she
is -- which sometimes gets her into trouble.
A 16-year-old student in Kisaragi High class 2-9.
Lives very close to Naomi, and generally accompanies
her to and from school each day.
A free spirit, she often says or does things that
take others by surprise -- though she's also easily
forgiven due to her good nature and amiability.
Her mother disappeared three years ago, leaving her
with three younger siblings and a working father. As
such, she basically serves as head of the household.
bをやいている。
Seiko seems to regard Naomi as a kindred spirit, and
the two of them frequently have long conversations
about their many dreams for the future.
A lone frog soaking in formalin sits upon the top
shelf, eagerly awaiting dissection.
A 23-year-old 11th grade English teacher at Kisaragi
High. Just started this semester after passing her
teaching exam, and is eager to make an impression.
、２年９組を受け持つ事になった。
Although not a perfect instructor by any means, her
unjaded zeal and enthusiasm are infectious, and her
students seem generally responsive to her methods.
る。
Also serves as a teacher's assistant during homeroom
for class 2-9, and really seems to have connected
with the students there.
目を輝かせる。

A victim of the serial kidnapping and murder
incident that occurred within Heavenly Host
Elementary in 1973.
Was discovered with his tongue severed and his
abdomen brutally dug out by a sharp object.
A victim of the serial kidnapping and murder
incident that occurred within Heavenly Host
Elementary in 1973.
Was discovered with her left eye smashed to a pulp
and her tongue severed.
A victim of the serial kidnapping and murder
incident that occurred within Heavenly Host
Elementary in 1973.
Was discovered with everything from the jaw up
completely cut away and missing, including her
tongue.
The girl in the red dress. Reported to be the
sole survivor of the serial kidnapping and murder
incident of 1973.
In actuality, she's the vengeful, malevolent spirit
of a girl who was killed by Takamine Yanagihori
twenty years earlier, along with her mother.
Takamine Yanagihori's son and a former teacher at
Heavenly Host. Blamed for the serial kidnapping and
murder incident. Sachiko's accomplice.
力者。
Suffered a unique mental illness of unknown origin
prior to the time of the incident, making it very
hard for him to communicate with others.
Heavenly Host Elementary's principal, and
Yoshikazu's father. When the school was scheduled
to be demolished, he threw himself from its roof.
て自殺した。
Murderer of Yoshie and Sachiko Shinozaki, making
him the primary cause of the school's curse.
Sachiko Shinozaki's mother, and a nurse at Heavenly
Host Elementary at the time of her demise.
Fell down the stairs to her death one day, and her
daughter went missing around the same time.
A spirit who's been around since long before
Heavenly Host Elementary. Known as one of the seven
wonders of Kisaragi High: 'Shimoda of the Toilet.'
Lived on this land as a nobleman long before
a school was built here.
